title: Information related to the plaque commemorating the Street Tree campaign

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please provide all information held relating to any communications with all those identified as representing 'STAG' (Sheffield Tree Action Group), associated with the proposed Town Hall plaque (commemorating the campaign opposing the unnecessary felling of healthy street trees in Sheffield).
With suitable redaction of personal information.
Yours, in expectation of a swift response,
Mr. Buxton

Thank you for your message.
This mailbox will not be monitored from the afternoon of 22nd December
2023 until our return on 02/01/2024. However, we undertake to meet all
legal deadlines we are obliged to.
Happy holidays and a peaceful New Year.
This Email, and any attachments, may contain non-public information and is
intended solely for the individual(s) to whom it is addressed. It may
contain sensitive or protectively marked material and should be handled
accordingly. If this Email has been misdirected, please notify the author
immediately. If you are not the intended recipient you must not disclose,
distribute, copy, print or rely on any of the information contained in it
or attached, and all copies must be deleted immediately. Whilst we take
reasonable steps to try to identify any software viruses, any attachments
to this Email may nevertheless contain viruses which our anti-virus
software has failed to identify. You should therefore carry out your own
anti-virus checks before opening any documents. Sheffield City Council
will not accept any liability for damage caused by computer viruses
emanating from any attachment or other document supplied with this e-mail

Dear Mr. Buxton,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Street Trees plaque
which we received on 01/01/2024.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 30/01/2024. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Mr Buxton
We apologise for failing to meet the legal deadline for our response to
your request of 1 January 2024 which is due today. We have all the
correspondence but have yet to redact and consult third parties. We would
appreciate your patience until 9 February 2024.
Kind regards
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear FOI,
I am disappointed you've not managed to comply with legislation. Is there still a backlog from Covid?
Please could you clarify in detail, your following statement "We have all the correspondence but have yet to... consult third parties."?
Many thanks in anticipation of an immediate response.
Mr. Buxton

Dear Mr Buxton
We do have a backlog but not Covid-related. We are a small team with a
busy Inbox with responses which require care and time.
You have asked for our correspondence with STAG regarding the Town Hall
plaque. The Freedom of Information Code of Practice under Section 45 of
the Act, published by the Cabinet Office in July 2018, contains guidance
on consultation with third parties on page 16:
[1]CoP_FOI_Code_of_Practice_-_Minor_Amendments_20180926_.pdf
(publishing.service.gov.uk)
We follow that guidance.
Thank you for bearing with us.
Kind regards
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [2][Sheffield City Council request email]

Dear FOI,
Please could you advise if the 'third party' has acknowledged your communication regarding this request?
Furthermore, if the 'third party' fails to respond. What are the alternatives for obtaining the information requested?
This also raises the question of... whether a deadline has actually been specified by SCC to the 'third party', I would also appreciate clarification of this matter ASAP.
Yours sincerely,
Mr. Buxton

Dear FOI,
Please could you advise if the 'third party' has acknowledged your communication regarding this request?
Furthermore, if the third party fails to respond. What are the alternatives for obtaining the information requested?
This also raises the question of... whether a deadline has actually been specified by SCC, I would also appreciate clarification of this matter ASAP.
Yours sincerely,
Mr. Buxton

Dear Mr Buxton
We have not prepared the material for consultation. This involves bundling
it chronologically and provisionally redacting it. There's no delay on
STAG's part. They are unaware of the request; they have not been asked to
review the material.
It is likely that it will be a further fortnight before we are in a
position to reply to you. We've a heavy Inbox and it is taking time to get
through it.
Thank you for your patience.
Kind regards
Sheffield City Council
show quoted sections

Dear FOI,
Unfortunately this information request is now more than two weeks overdue. With no legitimate reason provided as to exactly why.
Please could you specify in detail why this failure has occurred and also explain the underlying cause(s) of such a failure?
Many thanks and kind regards.
Mr. Buxton

Dear Mr Buxton
Thank you for your email of 15 February 2024 enquiring about our late
response to you.
We have collated all the records relating to your request and sent them to
STAG. Public authorities are obliged to consult third parties where their
information is caught by a FOI request.
We expect to make our disclosure to you in the week beginning 26 February
2024.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear SCC FoI,
I regret to note I am still awaiting the information I  requested, despite your email above of 22nd February.
Please could you explain why this is the case?
Many thanks and best regards,
Mr. Buxton

Dear Mr Buxton
Thank you for your emails of 15 February and 1 March 2024 enquiring about
our late response to you.
We are now in a position to respond to you request for ‘all information
held relating to any communications with all those identified as
representing 'STAG' (Sheffield Tree Action Group), associated with the
proposed Town Hall plaque (commemorating the campaign opposing the
unnecessary felling of healthy street trees in Sheffield).’
The redacted documents are now attached. We hope these are not difficult
to follow: inevitably there is some repetition within email
correspondence.
Some of the information within the documents is exempt from disclosure
under section 40(2) of the Freedom of Information Act 2000 on the grounds
that it is personal data and disclosure would contravene the data
protection principle under Article 5(1)(a) of the General Data Protection
Regulation that processing of personal data must be fair, lawful and
transparent. This includes the names, contact details and personal
opinions of people within the correspondence.
The names of some staff have been redacted, following the Information
Commissioner’s [1]guidance on the redaction of staff names when responding
to requests made under the Freedom of Information Act 2000/ Environmental
Information Regulations 2004. This guidance advises that decisions whether
to disclose staff names should be taken on a case-by-case basis, but
relevant factors to consider include the seniority of the staff involved
and whether the staff have a reasonable expectation that their names will
be released. Our usual policy is not to release the names of staff below
Head of Service level, which takes into account that staff have the
reasonable expectation that their names would not be released in a
disclosure to the world.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [2]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response. Of
course we acknowledge and apologise for the significant delay in
responding.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[3]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [4][Sheffield City Council request email]
